Variable name: Employed population. Population All Ages. individuals
Intuitive description: Population within percentile p0p100. The population is comprised of individuals of all ages. The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
Sources: [URL][URL_LINK]http://wid.world/document/t-piketty-l-yang-and-g-zucman-capital-accumulation-private-property-and-inequality-in-china-1978-2015-2016/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Piketty, Thomas; Yang, Li and Zucman, Gabriel (2016). Capital Accumulation, Private Property and Rising Inequality in China, 1978-2015[/URL_TEXT][/URL];

Variable name: Net national wealth to Net National Income Ratio. Wealth-income ratio All Ages. individuals
Intuitive description: Wealth-Income Ratio is the division of national wealth by national income.
Sources: [URL][URL_LINK]http://wid.world/document/t-piketty-l-yang-and-g-zucman-capital-accumulation-private-property-and-inequality-in-china-1978-2015-2016/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Piketty, Thomas; Yang, Li and Zucman, Gabriel (2016). Capital Accumulation, Private Property and Rising Inequality in China, 1978-2015[/URL_TEXT][/URL];

Variable name: Market-value national wealth. Average Adults. individuals
Intuitive description: Average Market-value national wealth within a given percentile group. Net national wealth is the total value of assets (cash, housing, bonds, equities, etc.) owned by the national economy, minus its debts. The national economy - in the national accounts sense - includes all domestic sectors, i.e. all entities that are resident of a given country (in the sense of their economic activity), whether they belong to the private sector, the corporate sector, the governement sector. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
Technical description: [Market-value national wealth ]=[National non-financial assets (market value)]+[Net foreign assets]
Sources: [URL][URL_LINK]http://wid.world/document/t-piketty-l-yang-and-g-zucman-capital-accumulation-private-property-and-inequality-in-china-1978-2015-2016/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Piketty, Thomas; Yang, Li and Zucman, Gabriel (2016). Capital Accumulation, Private Property and Rising Inequality in China, 1978-2015[/URL_TEXT][/URL];

Variable name: Employed population. Population All Ages. individuals
Intuitive description: Population within percentile p0p100. The population is comprised of individuals of all ages. The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.

Sources: [URL][URL_LINK]http://wid.world/document/revised-extended-national-wealth-series-australia-canada-france-germany-italy-japan-uk-usa-wid-world-technical-note-2017-23/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Piketty, Thomas; Zucman, Gabriel (2014).Capital is back: Wealth-Income ratios in Rich Countries 1700-2010.
